item.title: Diving scientists record 'cloud' of thousands of swarming crabs
item.description:
Diving scientists record 'cloud' of thousands of swarming crabs

Descending in a submersible in waters off Panama, scientists noticed something strange happening near the seafloor. It was a drifting fog of sediment, disturbed by something below. Diving deeper, the scientists found the cause: crabs, thousands of them, swarming in a way never before recorded.

Shark Attack Compared to Other Risks :: Florida Museum of Natural History

The relative risk of shark attacks to humans compared to other risks.

item.title: Risk of dying and sporting activities
item.description:
Risk of dying and sporting activities

The risk of dying associated with most sporting activities is surprisingly low, even with skydiving or hang gliding. Soreide et al. J Trauma. 2007;62:1113-1117. How Dangerous is BASE Jumping? An Analysis of Adverse Events in 20,850 Jumps From the Kjerag Massif, Norway Turk et al. Br. J. Sports Med. 2008;42;604-608.
